class menu.Menu(context: str, options: list[str], functions)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Menu class represents a generic menu system with options and associated functions.

context¶

The text displayed before the options, providing context to the user.

Type:

str

option¶

A formatted string of options presented to the user.

Type:

str

functions¶

A list of functions corresponding to each option. Each function should return a Menu instance.

Type:

list

error_show(text: str, time: float) → None[source]¶

Displays an error message and pauses execution for a specified time.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The error message to display.

  • time (float) – The time to pause execution in seconds.

generate_text_menu(option: list[str]) → str[source]¶

Generates a formatted string of options with corresponding indices.

Parameters:

option (list[str]) – A list of option descriptions.

Returns:

A formatted string of options.

Return type:

str

is_valid_input(input: str) → bool[source]¶

Checks if the user input is valid (either “exit” or a number corresponding to an option).

Parameters:

input (str) – The user input to validate.

Returns:

True if the input is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

run()[source]¶

Runs the menu, displaying options and handling user input until a valid choice is made. Returns the function corresponding to the chosen option.

Returns:

The function corresponding to the chosen option.

Return type:

callable
